title.narrative: Afghanistan (l'): Aide ciblée aux pays
Afghanistan: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement

1. EVM assessment completed, and comprehensive EVM improvement plans developed for five years which will be fed into the development of upcoming HSS4 proposal. 2. Functionality rate of cold chain equipment improved. 3. PSR" related to Portfolio planning pertaining to cold chain developed with support from country partners.

target.value: Staff support (P3)

comment.narrative: 1. EVM assessment has been completed. Report is attached. 2. Functionality rate of cold chain increased from 93% to 94.2%. 3. Now, the Theory of Change (ToC) is used instead of PSR. Development of ToC for cold chain is under process.

target.value: Staff support (P3)

comment.narrative: 1. EVM assessment has been completed. Report is attached. 2. Functionality rate of cold chain increased from 93% to 94.2%. 3. Now, the Theory of Change (ToC) is used instead of PSR. Development of ToC for cold chain is under process.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Financial/General Management

1. No vaccine stock out at Regional/Provincial levels during the reporting period 2. Sickness rate of cold chain equipment is <5% during the reporting period 3. Communication material updated, printed and disseminated

target.value: 11 NTA staff: Tehnical support to data, communication, HSS, cold chain, servivice dleivery, surviellance, finance, coordination by NTAs to EPI programme through MoPH.

comment.narrative: 1. No stock of routine EPI and COVID-19 vaccines has been reported during July-Nov 2021. Country experienced stock-out of COVID-19 vaccine in first half of 2021. 2. Functionality rate of cold chain increased from 93% to 94.2%. Fresh inventory is under process, and new functionality rate will become available by end of 2021. 3. Designed, printed and distributed the following IEC materials for routine EPI: 25, 530 vaccines banners, 135,000 posters, 385,000 leaflets, 3,000 EPI stickers, 1,000 suit pitches.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Data

1. Capacity of National Data team and 34 Provincial Data Officers in information collation and analysis increased. 2. COVID 19 vaccination data collection system is developed and implemented by mid 2021.

target.value: One staff at P3: Technical support to improve quality of EPI data

comment.narrative: 1. Only one training for national data team has been conducted. Other capacity building related activities did not proceed due to fragile situation in the country. 2. COVID-19 vaccination data collection system is already in place. Data are recorded on the standard registration materials in the field (vaccination sessions), compiled and uploaded onto the DHIS2.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM

1. CD+ implemented in 13 low performing districts. 2. Religious leaders training completed in 25 provinces. 3. PSR" related to Portfolio planning pertaining to demand generation developed with support from country partners.

target.value: Staff support (NO-B)

comment.narrative: 1. CD+ project was completed in April 2021. The project extended for another three months (by end of July 2021) upon request of MoPH to make sure optimal result is achieved. Evaluation by third party is under contract process. 2. Reported earlier; religious leaders? training has been completed in 2020 and a total of 13,730 religious scholars received training across the country. 3. Human Centered Designed Approach study has been conducted and results fed into Theory of Change. ToC reports for demand are attached.

target.value: Staff support (NO-B)

comment.narrative: 1. CD+ project was completed in April 2021. The project extended for another three months (by end of July 2021) upon request of MoPH to make sure optimal result is achieved. Evaluation by third party is under contract process. 2. Reported earlier; religious leaders? training has been completed in 2020 and a total of 13,730 religious scholars received training across the country. 3. Human Centered Designed Approach study has been conducted and results fed into Theory of Change. ToC reports for demand are attached.

title.narrative: 1. Communication materials designed, developed and broadcasted for COVID-19 vaccination programme. 2. Perception study on COVID-19 vaccine conducted.

target.value: One staff at NOB: Technical suppor to demand generation related interventions

comment.narrative: 1. Specifically using the PEF/TCA, 12,600 IPCI and EPI communication training guideline and COVID-19 vaccine Q&A booklet have been printed, nine IPCI training manuals and video job aids have been translated into local languages, seven IPCI video training clips have been dubbed. The incumbent C4D officer financed by PEF/TCA has also managed for COVID-19 vaccination related communication work using other funding sources as follows: designing and printing of additional IPCI and EPI communication materials and job aids, production of 8 COVID-19 TV and radio spots and animation clips, production of 6 religious scholars? messages on COVID-19 for TV and radio, insertion of 5,787 TV and 11,130 radio messages on importance of COVID-19 vaccine, arrangement/rollout of one advocacy event on COVID-19 vaccine, installation of 20 billboards on COVID-19 vaccinations, preparation for edutainment and promotion of COVID-19 vaccination through social media. Furthermore, designed, printed and distributed the following IEC materials for COVID-19 vaccinations: 5,000 banners, 12,000 posters, 100,000 leaflets, 74 standees, and 10,000 suit pitches. 2. Formative study on perception on COVID-19 vaccine has been completed. Report is attached. Well-designed version is under process and will be shared later.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Management - LMC
1. Installed 300 SDDs and 100 electrict refregerators (CCEOP). 2. 14 EPI buildings (warehouses and cold rooms) constructed.

target.value: National Technical Assistance (NTA) through MoPH

comment.narrative: 1. During first six months of 2021, under CCEOP project/grant a total of 190 SDDs and 136 electric refrigerators have been installed. 2. During reporting period, 4 buildings (one regional warehouse and 3 provincial vaccine stores in next few days) have been completed and now in use. Two buildings are currently under construction. In general, a total of 23 buildings have been completed.

target.value: National Technical Assistance (NTA) through MoPH

comment.narrative: 1. During first six months of 2021, under CCEOP project/grant a total of 190 SDDs and 136 electric refrigerators have been installed. 2. During reporting period, 4 buildings (one regional warehouse and 3 provincial vaccine stores in next few days) have been completed and now in use. Two buildings are currently under construction. In general, a total of 23 buildings have been completed.

title.narrative: 1. Installed 250 SDDs (CCEOP) 2. Regularize supply delivery at sub-national level

target.value: National Technical Assistance (NTA) through MoPH

comment.narrative: 1. Under CCEOP project/grant, in total 353 refrigerators (136 electric and 217 SDDs) have been installed. 2. Supply delivery at sub-national level has been regularized.

title.narrative: UNICEF

1. Installed 300 SDDs and 100 electrict refregerators (CCEOP). 2. Conducted temperature mapping in all Walk-in cold rooms in one national and 7 regions. 3. Training manual for vaccine management and cold chain available.

target.value: Staff support (P3)

comment.narrative: 1. Under CCEOP project/grant, in total 353 refrigerators (136 electric and 217 SDDs) have been installed. 2. Temperature mapping is not yet conducted. 3. Training manual for vaccine management and cold chain are not yet developed.

title.narrative: PoAs based on review and assessment developed for improving coverage and equity

target.value: Conductl EPI comprehensive review Plus immunization missed opportunity assessment

comment.narrative: Guideline, questionaires and tools had been adopted/developped, translated into local language and printed. But due to covid-19 pandimic it was postponed and fund was transferred to Covid 16 control programs.

target.value: Conductl EPI comprehensive review Plus immunization missed opportunity assessment

comment.narrative: The routine immunization plan of action for increasing coverage and equity was developed in Jan 2021. The comprehensive EPI review and MOV is pending because of restriction due to active fighting in many parts of the country and frequent lockdown because of COVID19. Please note that the protocols, questionaries' and tools are already developed and translated into local languages.

target.value: Staff support (P3)

title.narrative: WHO : Vaccine-Specific Support
Application for MSIAs is developped and submitted

target.value: Provide technical support in developing application for nationwide measles SIAs in 2022

comment.narrative: Appication for 2022 national measles SIAs developed by WHO CO in consultation with MOPH, UNICEF CO, UNICEF ROSA, WHO EMRO and HQ and local partners. The NTCC reviewed and finalized in July 2021. Because of political changes in the country, and it took long time to get the signatures of authorities from MOPH and MOF. Finally, on 5th Nov both Ministry put their signatures and submitted to GAVI.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
100% staff are selected and trained on Hep B sero-survey

target.value: Conduct Hepatitis B serosurvey to establish a baseline

comment.narrative: Because of the sero survey cancelation the plan activity couldn't take place.

title.narrative: All 7 VPD labs are provided with necessary logistics including diagnostic kits.

target.value: Logistical support to 7 Labs/hospitals for continuance of Rotavirus /intussusception surveillance

comment.narrative: Logisitcal support by WHO is going on to all 9 labs.

target.value: Logistical support to 7 Labs/hospitals for continuance of Rotavirus /intussusception surveillance

comment.narrative: Logisitcal support by WHO is going on to all 9 labs.

target.value: Logistical support to 7 labs/hospital for continuation of MR/CRS surveillance

comment.narrative: The VPD surveillance with lab support is functional through 9 children hospitals in Labs including 7 regional labs. WHO is providing technical logistic and performance based incentive to all surveillance staff in 9 hospitals in Labs, its because the VPD surveillance is not included into the routine activities of hospitals, the diagnosis is taking place based on clinical symptoms; therefore, WHO is providing incentive to surveillance lab staff to be engaged in VPD surveillance after official working hours. Based on the needs of laboratories WHO provided equipment and supplies to all labs including IT equipment.

target.value: Logistical support to 7 labs/hospital for continuation of MR/CRS surveillance

comment.narrative: The VPD surveillance with lab support is functional through 9 children hospitals in Labs including 7 regional labs. WHO is providing technical logistic and performance based incentive to all surveillance staff in 9 hospitals in Labs, its because the VPD surveillance is not included into the routine activities of hospitals, the diagnosis is taking place based on clinical symptoms; therefore, WHO is providing incentive to surveillance lab staff to be engaged in VPD surveillance after official working hours. Based on the needs of laboratories WHO provided equipment and supplies to all labs including IT equipment.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
EVM improving plan developed for next five year. Cold chain capacity assesmet completed for COVID-19 vaccine introduction.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
120 EPI staff (managers and supervisors) at the national and sub-national level trained on IPC

target.value: IPCI training for EPI managers, supervisors and frontline health workers

comment.narrative: IPC training module has been contextualized and converted/developed into Inter-personal Communication for Immunization (IPCI) module. The module has been designed and translated into local languages, printed, and video job aids have been dubbed into local languages. Implementation of the training is re-programmed by MoPH due to COVID-19 uncertain situation. The allocation of IPCI training will be spent in support of ACASUS-run project around EPI performance. Gavi agreed to this change.

target.value: IPCI training for EPI managers, supervisors and frontline health workers

comment.narrative: IPC training module has been contextualized and converted/developed into Inter-personal Communication for Immunization (IPCI) module. The module has been designed and translated into local languages, printed, and video job aids have been dubbed into local languages. Implementation of the training is re-programmed by MoPH due to COVID-19 uncertain situation. The allocation of IPCI training will be spent in support of ACASUS-run project around EPI performance. Gavi agreed to this change.

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
The annual plan of actions is approved

target.value: In close coordination with NIP and BPHS NGOs to conduct need assessment for planning refresher training courses on RI and facilitate training sessions; plan and conduct trainin courses on accelerated immunization activities, assist NIP in training of staff on Measles SIAs, introduction of new vaccine; develop training materials on different aspects of RI including EVMA, EPI review, DQs, coverage survey and annual review of national immunization programs and conduct field monitoring

comment.narrative: Because of coivid 19 pandemic some activities such as national EPI review, data quality audit, coverage survey, and Hep B serosurvey could not be conducted, and the fund from the 2021 work plan was transferred to Covid19 control and vaccination. The 4 rounds of accelerated immunization activities conducted in 7 provinces out of 10 because of continuous conflicts. Afghanistan is not eligible for introduction of new vaccines because of

target.value: Assist in planning, budgeting, procurement, receving and distribution of lab reagents, specimen collection kits, consumable supplies, equipment, recording and reporting materials for VPD surveillance; procurement of different items for RI programs and distribution to the labs and 34 provinces; and supporing NIP in VPD surveillance data entering; perform admin and finance support.

comment.narrative: List of all items procutred and distributed is attached

target.value: Provide technical and logistic support to MOPH by joint monthly and annual plan of actions for strenthening VPD surveillance system at all level of health system by planning/implementing training, supportive supervision, field monitoring, conducting monthly review of VPD surveillance and reporting to all partners

comment.narrative: TA/Amin/Finance support: appropriate logistics and financial facility for VPD surveillance and routine immunization, technical, administrative, financial management and good dealing with MOPH and partners provided by WHO EPI program and admin/finance assistants.

target.value: A / HSS National Program Officer to support coordination between HSS, RI program, MoPH line departments, BPHS/EPHS implementing NGOs, other partners, and donors, with a special focus on the following: - Contribute to the quarterly, semi-annual, and annual performance review of BPHS/EPHS implementers - Contribute to the Full Portfolio Planning and development of PSR - Contribute to EPI coverage survey - Contribute to AfDHS and facilitating the inclusion of immunization related indicators - Contribute to the introduction of COVID vaccine - Contribute to HSS/EPI related meetings, reviews, and workshops - Contribute to the development of new National Health Policy and Strategy and advocate for prioritizing immunization - Contribute to Polio transition planning

comment.narrative: WHO represented in almost EPI related forums at high level of MOPH including developing MOPH annual plan of actions insisting more on immunization planning, budgetting, accountability of the governent, strong stewardship, regular monitoring of BPHS/EPHS NGO performance, and reflecting all components including high coverage and equity of immunization national health policy and annual and strategic public health plan of the ministry of public health. The recent documents were developped by WHO where EPI is give high priority.

target.value: Provide administrative/finacial/technical support in planning, budgeting, managing, using of resources, controlling, accounting monitoring of correct using of fund and timely reporting to the relevant partners; facilitating EPI/VPD surveillance related training courses, workshops, EPI reviews, assessments, and monitoring of using funds at sub-national level.

comment.narrative: WHO represented in almost EPI related forums at high level of MOPH including developing MOPH annual plan of actions insisting more on immunization planning, budgetting, accountability of the governent, strong stewardship, regular monitoring of BPHS/EPHS NGO performance, and reflecting all components including high coverage and equity of immunization national health policy and annual and strategic public health plan of the ministry of public health. The recent documents were developped by WHO where EPI is give high priority.

title.narrative: Annual detailed plan of actions are available

comment.narrative: The annual detail plan of action between WHO health system unit, line departments of MOPH , BPHS partners and other relevant organization is in place.

target.value: Assist in planning, budgeting, procurement, receving and distribution of lab reagents, specimen collection kits, consumable supplies, equipment, recording and reporting materials for VPD surveillance; procurement of different items for RI programs and distribution to the labs and 34 provinces; and supporing NIP in VPD surveillance data entering; perform admin and finance support.

comment.narrative: The position is occupied.

comment.narrative: The position of is occupied and the activities going on according to the plan and schedule.

target.value: In close coordination with NIP and BPHS NGOs to conduct need assessment for planning refresher training courses on RI and facilitate training sessions; plan and conduct trainin courses on accelerated immunization activities, assist NIP in training of staff on Measles SIAs, introduction of new vaccine; develop training materials on different aspects of RI including EVMA, EPI review, DQs, coverage survey and annual review of national immunization programs and conduct field monitoring

comment.narrative: The position of is occupied and the activities going on according to the plan of action,

title.narrative: UNICEF : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)

? Final version of monthly datapacks for new regions ? Overview and success factors for activities and responsibilities to transfer to Government during Phase III ? Revised supervisor training materials ? Quarterly progress report

target.value: 1) Drive further improvements in performance in the 17 provinces in which the program is already live. 2) Expand the program across the remaining 17 provinces. 3) Launch a pilot to monitor outreach performance in three provinces. 4) Strengthen performance management by creating new ?meeting facilitation manuals?, and developing ?best practice? case studies on improvements delivered by managers. 5)Hardwire sustainability into the approach through progressively transferring responsibilities to NEPI teams, and through developing an ?LMC implementation manual? for EPI managers.

comment.narrative: Monthly data-pack is available for 17 provinces (different regions) available. Scale-up in remaining province await new mobile phones to reach to the country (flight disruption due to situation). Mobile phones arrived Kabul on 15th Nov 2021, and scale-up will be initiated soon. Phase-wise plan is finalized and shared with Gavi already. Transfer of responsibilities take place based on the agreed plan step by step. Revised supervisory training materials are available. Quarterly reports submitted to Gavi by ACASUS.

title.narrative: Plan to scale-up across 17 new provinces

target.value: 1) Drive further improvements in performance in the 17 provinces in which the program is already live. 2) Expand the program across the remaining 17 provinces. 3) Launch a pilot to monitor outreach performance in three provinces. 4) Strengthen performance management by creating new ?meeting facilitation manuals?, and developing ?best practice? case studies on improvements delivered by managers. 5)Hardwire sustainability into the approach through progressively transferring responsibilities to NEPI teams, and through developing an ?LMC implementation manual? for EPI managers.

comment.narrative: This is managed by ACASUS through NEPI department of MoPH. It is a programme called Leadership Management and Coordination (LMP) focusing on EPI performance management. Scale-up plan is developed, procurement of required item (phone and top-up) have been initiated, actual scale-up will commence in July 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Human Resources for Health
NITAG and other technical fourm meetings

comment.narrative: NITAG and TAG meetings couldn't take place in 2021.

comment.narrative: Task force meeting conducted bi-weekly and minutes of the meeting were followed up by taking actions where there were need. But, NEPI could not organize at least one NITAG meeting in 2021 because of security problems and emigration of core staff.

title.narrative: All the required items are provided quarterly for continuation of VPD surveillance system

target.value: WHO to contnue its logistic support to MOPH by providng diagnostic kits, lab supplies/equipment, recording and reporting materials for Measles cased-based, Rubella case-based , CRS case-based, Rotavirus, IBD, and intusussception surveillance for 9 hospitals and laboratories

comment.narrative: Based on the needs and the request from the labs the required equipment and supplies provided on quarterly basis and in case of shortage action is taking timely.

title.narrative: Protocols, tools and other documents are adapted

target.value: Provide technical assistance in carrying out hospital/lab-based serosurvey

comment.narrative: Protocol, questionaries', tools for comprehensive EPI review MOV and sero survey are in place.

title.narrative: All the training materials and tools are available

target.value: Strengthen vaccine/injection safety and AEFI surveillance by buidlding the capacity of provincial technical committess (100 medical doctors) for detection, investigation and response vaccines side effects

comment.narrative: The training materials for the mentioned activities are available and incorporated into national EPI guideline.

title.narrative: Quarterly provision of lab items

target.value: WHO to contnue its logistic support to MOPH by providng diagnostic kits, lab supplies/equipment, recording and reporting materials for Measles cased-based, Rubella case-based , CRS case-based, Rotavirus, IBD, and intusussception surveillance for 9 hospitals and laboratories

comment.narrative: Total 32 Lab technician 2 from each site (indragandi hospital, Maiwand hospital, Balkh regional hospital, Herat regional hospital, Kandahar regional hospital, Nangarhar regional hospital) and 2 new sites( Kunduz& Gardiz) trained for 3 days on VPDs general procedure and 3 day on Lab specific issues in CPHL for practical work. Now the Lab technician are able to perform the Laboratory process for VPDs at regional level. VPD sample collection become easy the interval between sample collection and Lab investigation become short, in this case the surveillance indicter s for reporting/investigation of the cases improved to 80% sample condition improved about 90% and feedback on time to the EPI improved from 0 - 65% .

title.narrative: 50% of planned focal points are trained 50% of field visits conducted Monthly provincial review of VPD surveillance conducted Monthly VPD surveillance data submitted Surveillance reports shared with all partners

target.value: Build the technical capacity of of surveillance staff by training of 100 surveillance focal points at sub-national level, field visits, monitoring, regular review of VPD surveillance

comment.narrative: Total 55 EPI staff trained on AEFI surveillance (25 provincial EPI managers, BPHS implementers EPI officers, 24 regional master trainers and 6 national EPI officer from national EPI and NGOs EPI officers. The topics were (immunization & immunity, AEFI case detection reporting and investigation, Role and responsibility of the partners in AEFI surveillance, Monitoring and supervision of AEFI surveillance system, communication for strengthen of AEFI surveillance and causality assessment.

title.narrative: 50% of the planned staff are trained

high risk districts/areas are identified based on deep analysis of RI and VPD surveillance data

title.narrative: Assesment/training package and tools are availale

target.value: Assist MOPH/BPHS implementing partners in assessment of VPD outbreaks and in emergencies and prepare plan of actions for immunization of eligible children in emergency affected areas

comment.narrative: as planned, 34 MOPH data manager and 34 NGOs supervisors received a four day training on WHO guideline on measles investigation and outbreak response. The guidleine translated into local languages and distrbituted to all the partcipants. The MR surveillance sustem has the capacity to detect and investigated with 24 hours.
